fields.description: Part-museum, part-general store, this is worth a stop! This used to be the only grocery store on the Peninsula, and Regina would accompany her Grandma Bobbie here. Now Regina and her father come frequently for ice cream -- they have Moomers!
fields.address: 18250 Mission Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Old Mission General Store

fields.description: A nice place to grab a quick bite or a pizza. Regina says they have the best no-bake cookies in the world and gets one (and sometimes two!) every time she comes -- she even treated George to one the weekend he proposed!
fields.address: 14111 Center Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: The Peninsula Market

fields.description: Just a short drive from Regina’s parents’ house, this old lighthouse has a lovely beach and is a fun place to visit!
fields.address: 20500 Center Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: The Lighthouse

fields.description: This boutique winery and vineyard is the creation of HGTV star, Carter Oosterhouse, and his brother, Todd. The menu was developed with celebrity chef, Mario Batali.
fields.address: 12011 Center Rd, Traverse City, MI 49685
fields.name: Bonobo

fields.description: A family-run boutique winery near Bowers Harbor Park.
fields.address: 2896 Bowers Harbor Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Bowers Harbor

fields.description: This brick and mahogany tasting room has a lovely patio and sits on a centennial cherry farm.
fields.address: 3309 Blue Water Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Brys Estate Vineyard

fields.description: Regina’s favorite. This Old World-inspired winery sits on a hilltop, affording gorgeous views of grapevine-trellised hillsides and the bay.
fields.address: 15900 Rue Devin, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Chateau Chantal

fields.description: One of the region’s first wineries, this put Michigan on the map for world-class wines.
fields.address: 12239 Center Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Chateau Grand Traverse

fields.description: A family-run winery housed in a one-room schoolhouse that was built in 1896!
fields.address: 11480 Center Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Peninsula Cellars

fields.description: Really beautiful, ultra-modern facility with views of the East Bay.
fields.address: 16985 Smokey Hollow Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Two Lads

fields.description: A charming vineyard bed and breakfast. There are only three rooms available, and they allow children provided that the other guests say it's ok. Could be an option for a family group that wants to occupy all three rooms.
fields.address: 1994 Carroll Road Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Grey Hare Inn

fields.description: With six private and secluded rooms with views of the lake and vineyard, this is where I would want to stay! Each room receives a bottle of wine at night to be enjoyed on the private balcony, and all food is prepared by an in-house chef. Rooms are reasonably priced, especially given the location and amenities.
fields.address: 12239 Center Road, Traverse City, MI 49686 USA
fields.name: The Inn at Chateau Grand Traverse

fields.description: A historic inn just minutes away from my parents' house and close to a number of restaurants and wineries. They no longer allow children under 18, but it's a lovely place for couples.
fields.address: 18599 Mission Rd  Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Old Mission Inn

fields.description: George's mother is staying here, but there are very few rooms available. That being said, this is our favorite place to gather for wine tasting and to enjoy the gorgeous views; it would be a fun place to go with friends and family during the wedding weekend.
fields.address: 15900 Rue de Vin Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Chateau Chantal

fields.description: Lovely lavender products!
fields.address: 17770 Center Rd, Old Mission, MI 49673
fields.name: Harbor View Nursery and Lavender Farm

fields.description: Bowers Harbor Inn is allegedly haunted by Genevive the Ghost. While it is no longer an inn, it hosts the lovely restaurant Mission Table (dinner only) as well as the brewery, Jolly Pumpkin. Always a fun place to visit--this is almost where Regina and George had their wedding.
fields.address: 13512 Peninsula Dr, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: Jolly Pumpkin Brewery and the old Bowers Harbor Inn

fields.description: When Regina was younger, she would come here for “lunch” and feast on the ample samples. She shows more restraint today, but this is a must-stop for all things cherry.
fields.address: 154 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Cherry Republic

fields.description: When Regina was younger, she would come here for “lunch” and feast on the ample samples. She shows more restraint today, but this is a must-stop for all things cherry.
fields.address: 230 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: American Spoon Foods

fields.description: ENTER DESCRIPTION
fields.address: 144 Hall St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: BLK Market

fields.description: [ enter description ]
fields.address: 108 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Brew

fields.description: Regina and her mother are particularly fond of their chai lattes.
fields.address: 202 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Espresso Bay

fields.description: Voted one of the best in the country!
fields.address: 128 S Union St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: 7 monks Taproom

fields.description: This is also where you can find products made with the grapes produced at  Regina’s Uncle Bob’s vineyard!
fields.address: 806 Red Dr, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Left Foot Charley

fields.description: Great whitefish and bay views!
fields.address: 13671 S W Bay Shore Dr, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Apache Trout Grill

fields.description: European Fare and lovely atmosphere.
fields.address: 229 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Amical

fields.description: For soups and sandwiches. The Asiago Garlic Bread is a must-try.
fields.address: 601 Randolph St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Bay Bread

fields.description: For great Italian products and the best olives ever. They also have delicious made-to-order sandwiches.
fields.address: 424 W Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Folgarelli’s

fields.description: Another Mario Batali favorite
fields.address: 619 Randolph St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Frenchie’s Famous

fields.description: Authentic Asian & Latin Taqueria
fields.address: 236 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Georgina’s

fields.description: For The Gobbler, a famous turkey sandwich.
fields.address: 539 W Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Mary’s Kitchen Port

fields.description: This used to be Regina’s favorite restaurant--try the tomato soup!
fields.address: 128 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Poppycocks’s

fields.description: The cherry crumb pie is to die for; Mario Batali has called it “a religious experience.”
fields.address: 525 W Front Street, Traverse City
fields.name: Grand Traverse Pie Company

fields.description: You can drive out to their headquarters on the Leelanau Peninsula or find it on Front Street in some of the food shops  in Downtown Traverse City Moomers won Best Ice Cream Parlor in the United States!
fields.address: 7263. N. Long Lake Road, Traverse City, MI 49685
fields.name: Moomers Ice Cream

fields.description: It's a bookstore!
fields.address: 243 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Horizon Books

fields.description: Another bookstore!
fields.address: 118 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Brilliant Books

fields.description: Delicious cheeses, meats, and wines for a picnic!
fields.address: 509 W Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Burritt’s

fields.description: Built in 1916, is the crown jewel of Traverse City’s cultural scene. Saved nearly a decade ago with the help of Michael Moore, it’s one of the region’s best historic preservation stories.
fields.address: 233 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: The State Theatre

fields.description: Cited as “The Most Beautiful Place in America” by Good Morning America, this is a must-do if you have the time. Regina’s family tries to do the dune climb, always ending with a dip in Lake Michigan, at least once a summer. Don’t forget to stop at the stunning Pyramid Point for a photo!
fields.address: 9922 W Front St, Empire, MI 49630
fields.name: Sleeping Bear Dunes

fields.description: A beautiful lodge located in the northernmost area of Leelanau. It's about 15 minutes from the wedding location and 30 minutes from downtown Traverse City. Since it's more secluded, it's a great base to explore the area and would put you close to the Sleeping Bear Dunes, local wineries, and a variety of activities like hiking, biking, and canoeing.
fields.address: 12819 Tatch Rd, Omena, Michigan 49674
fields.name: Sunset Lodge

fields.description: A historic summer resort right on the beach. There are 19 cottages available as well as hotel rooms for nightly stays; they can accommodate up to 50 guests. This would put you 30 minutes from downtown Traverse City and 10 minutes from the wedding venue. This place books quickly, but they may still have a few cottages available.
fields.address: 990 S Lake Leelanau Dr, Lake Leelanau, MI 49653
fields.name: Fountain Point Resort

fields.description: While this place sports an early 90s vibe, the location is great and there's a beautiful patio with sweeping lake views where you can socialize and enjoy some wine. It's just a few miles away from the wedding venue and is a great option for anyone who wants to gamble! Price is great too--since you're on the reservation, there are no taxes.
fields.address: 2521 N West Bay Shore Dr, Peshawbestown, MI 49682
fields.name: Leelanau Sands Casino

fields.description: Always a must-stop
fields.address: 422 N St Joseph St, Suttons Bay, MI 49682
fields.name: The Ice Cream Factory

fields.description: definitely the most famous
fields.address: 10844 E Revold Rd, Suttons Bay, MI 49682
fields.name: Black Star Farms

fields.description: don’t worry about visiting this one ahead of time--you’ll see it at the wedding! It’s claim to fame may be that it is owned by Madonna’s parents. Yes, that Madonna.
fields.address: 10343 E Hilltop Rd, Suttons Bay, MI 49682
fields.name: Ciccone Vineyards

fields.description: Known for its sparkling wine.
fields.address: 4519 Elm Valley Rd, Suttons Bay, MI 49682
fields.name: L. Mawby Vineyards

fields.description: Lovely outdoor spot.
fields.address: 9580 E Shady Ln, Suttons Bay, MI 49682
fields.name: Shady Lane Cellars

fields.description: The nicest Holiday Inn we've ever seen! It's three blocks from downtown Traverse City, and right on the beach. It definitely has a resort feel, and there are sweeping views of the lake and lots of places to lounge. It's a happening place, and while it's on the pricier side, it could be a great option for families.
fields.address: 615 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49686
fields.name: The Holiday Inn Resort

fields.description: A beautiful, historic hotel in the heart of downtown and within walking distance to the beach. Since it's not on the lake, the rooms are less expensive than those at the Holiday Inn.
fields.address: 300 East State Street, Traverse City, Michigan 49684
fields.name: Park Place Hotel

fields.description: This wasn't on the radar until one of Regina's bridesmaids mentioned it as a good option for those with children. It's a 10-15 minute drive from downtown Traverse City, and the indoor waterpark could provide hours of entertainment for the kiddos.
fields.address: 3575 N US Highway 31 S, Traverse City, MI 49684
fields.name: Great Wolf Lodge

fields.description: A large and lovely resort about 15 minutes from downtown Traverse City. They provide a variety of of amenities and activities as well as childcare. For those of you who are traveling with children, this could be a convenient option for the night of the wedding.
fields.address: 100 Grand Traverse Village Blvd., Box 404 Acme, MI 49610-0404
fields.name: Grand Traverse Resort and Spa
